title: Download ILSA files
text: Currently ILSAmerge able download several ILSA datasets, including: ‘PISA’, ‘TALIS’, ‘TIMSS’, ‘TIMSS Advanced’, ‘PIRLS’, ‘ICCS’, ‘ICILS’, ‘CIVED’, ‘REDS’, ‘RLII’, ‘SITES.’ links datasets allocated GitHub, links can corrected . small script, can check datasets available download:
code: ilsaliks <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dopatendo/ILSAmerge/refs/heads/main/data/ILSAlinks.csv" ilsas <- unique(read.csv(ilsaliks)[,1:2]) ilsas <- ilsas[!ilsas$Name%in%"Other",] ilsasU <- sort(unique(ilsas$Name))  for(i in 1:length(ilsasU)){   cat(paste0(ilsasU[i],": ",              paste0(ilsas$Year[ilsas$Name%in%ilsasU[i]],collapse = ", "),".\n")) } ## CIVED: 1999. ## ICCS: 2009, 2016, 2022. ## ICILS: 2013, 2018. ## PIRLS: 2001, 2006, 2011, 2016, 2021. ## PISA: 2022, 2018, 2015, 2012, 2009, 2006, 2003, 2000. ## PISA_CBA: 2012. ## PISA_ERA: 2009. ## PISA_FINANCIAL: 2012. ## REDS: 2021. ## RLII: 1991, 2001. ## SITES: 1998, 2006. ## TALIS: 2008, 2013, 2018. ## TIMSS: 1995, 1999, 2003, 2007, 2011, 2015, 2019. ## TIMSSADVANCED: 1995, 2008, 2015.

what: Download the datasets for a particular study
title: Download ILSA files
text: Depending study datasets uploaded 1 .zip files. ILSAdownload() handle many .zip files download. example, let us say want download data ‘RLII’ 1991. , least need opt three arguments; study, year, outputdir: can see, studies require agree license agreements. case, required answer agree . order continue, need agree. know agree study terms, can also avoid prompt via agreeLicense = TRUE:
code: ILSAdownload(study = "RLII", year = 1991, outputdir = tempdir()) ## By accessing the Data Repository, IDB Analyzer and Data visualizer, you indicate that you agree to the terms and conditions associated with their use. Please read the Disclaimer and License Agreement for full details. ## License Agreement downloaded. ## Do you agree with these terms and conditions? ## Please answer TRUE or FALSE. ILSAdownload(study = "RLII", year = 1991, outputdir = tempdir(),              agreeLicense = TRUE) ## By accessing the Data Repository, IDB Analyzer and Data visualizer, you indicate that you agree to the terms and conditions associated with their use. Please read the Disclaimer and License Agreement for full details. ## 1 files found for RLII 1991. ## Visit https://www.iea.nl/data-tools/repository/readingliteracy to know how to use and cite these datasets.

title: Download ILSA files
text: function can also unzip downloaded files using unzip = TRUE:
code: ILSAdownload(study = "RLII", year = 1991, outputdir = tempdir(),              unzip = TRUE)

title: Download ILSA files
text: possible avoid printing quiet = TRUE, still prompted agree. avoid prints can use arguments:
code: ILSAdownload(study = "RLII", year = 1991, outputdir = tempdir(),              quiet = TRUE, agreeLicense = TRUE)

title: Download ILSA files
text: Timeout times downloading controlled maxtime, can set desired number seconds:
code: ILSAdownload(study = "RLII", year = 1991, outputdir = tempdir(),              maxtime = 60)

title: Load ILSA files
text: can decide load population, like bcgv1, using justload(): result list elements loaded haven, example, list 11 elements:
code: loaded <- justload(inputdir = file.path(tempdir(),"REDS2021_IDB_SPSS/Data"),          population = "bcgv1") class(loaded) ## [1] "list"  length(loaded) ## [1] 11  loaded[[1]] ## # A tibble: 172 × 314 ##    IDCNTRY             IDSCHOOL ITLANGC      IP1G00A   IP1G00B      IP1G00C      ##    <dbl+lbl>           <dbl+lb> <dbl+lbl>    <dbl+lbl> <dbl+lbl>    <dbl+lbl>    ##  1 784 [United Arab E… 1001     53 [Arabic]  2 [Mid]   3 [March]    9 (NA) [Omi… ##  2 784 [United Arab E… 1002     53 [Arabic]  1 [Early] 2 [February] 3 [Late]     ##  3 784 [United Arab E… 1003     53 [Arabic]  1 [Early] 2 [February] 3 [Late]     ##  4 784 [United Arab E… 1004      1 [English] 3 [Late]  2 [February] 3 [Late]     ##  5 784 [United Arab E… 1005     53 [Arabic]  1 [Early] 3 [March]    3 [Late]     ##  6 784 [United Arab E… 1006     53 [Arabic]  2 [Mid]   2 [February] 2 [Mid]      ##  7 784 [United Arab E… 1007     53 [Arabic]  1 [Early] 3 [March]    3 [Late]     ##  8 784 [United Arab E… 1008     53 [Arabic]  1 [Early] 3 [March]    2 [Mid]      ##  9 784 [United Arab E… 1009     53 [Arabic]  2 [Mid]   3 [March]    1 [Early]    ## 10 784 [United Arab E… 1010     53 [Arabic]  2 [Mid]   6 [June]     3 [Late]     ## # ℹ 162 more rows ## # ℹ 308 more variables: IP1G00D <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIAA <dbl+lbl>, ## #   IP1GIAB <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIAC <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIAD <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIAE <dbl+lbl>, ## #   IP1GIAF <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIAG <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIBA <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIBB <dbl+lbl>, ## #   IP1GIBC <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIBD <dbl+lbl>, IP1G01A <dbl+lbl>, IP1G01B <dbl+lbl>, ## #   IP1G01C1 <dbl+lbl>, IP1G01C2 <dbl+lbl>, IP2G01A1 <dbl+lbl>, ## #   IP1G01AA <dbl+lbl>, IP1G02A <dbl+lbl>, IP1G02B <dbl+lbl>, …

title: Load ILSA files
text: purposes, might need load column information, probably check attributes correct. can setting justattributes = TRUE: load 11 datasets 0 rows :
code: loaded <- justload(inputdir = file.path(tempdir(),"REDS2021_IDB_SPSS/Data"),          population = "bcgv1", justattributes = TRUE) length(loaded) ## [1] 11  loaded[[1]] ## # A tibble: 0 × 314 ## # ℹ 314 variables: IDCNTRY <dbl+lbl>, IDSCHOOL <dbl+lbl>, ITLANGC <dbl+lbl>, ## #   IP1G00A <dbl+lbl>, IP1G00B <dbl+lbl>, IP1G00C <dbl+lbl>, IP1G00D <dbl+lbl>, ## #   IP1GIAA <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIAB <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIAC <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIAD <dbl+lbl>, ## #   IP1GIAE <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIAF <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIAG <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIBA <dbl+lbl>, ## #   IP1GIBB <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIBC <dbl+lbl>, IP1GIBD <dbl+lbl>, IP1G01A <dbl+lbl>, ## #   IP1G01B <dbl+lbl>, IP1G01C1 <dbl+lbl>, IP1G01C2 <dbl+lbl>, ## #   IP2G01A1 <dbl+lbl>, IP1G01AA <dbl+lbl>, IP1G02A <dbl+lbl>, …

title: Merge ILSA files
text: Depending goals capabilities computer, may consider adjusting options ILSAmerge(): population: need merge populations path, include character vector. format output ILSAfile.info(). MBlimit: set NULL, default, files merged within R. set numeric value establish limit (output ILSAfile.info()) files going merged R, populations go limit merged R, instead SPSS syntax produced. Later, can use syntax merge files. MBlistlimit: ILSAmerge() files merged two ways: using list produced lapply function, empty matrix filled subscripts. first method almost always faster, can use lot memory. argument establishes limit merging list matrix. recommend setting higher 200. SPSSlimit: SPSS syntaxes going produced important take account SPSS requirements handling files. vary SPSS version, normally total 50 files per command.

title: Merge ILSA files
text: ILSAmerge() runs, information progress merging running time produced:
code: ILSAmerge(inputdir = input, outputdir = output, filetype = c("rds", "zsav", "sav")) ## 9 files detected. Merging into 1 files. ## Merging ASCt1. Type 1 of 1. ## Merging dataset 1 of 9. ## Merging dataset 2 of 9. ## Merging dataset 3 of 9. ## Merging dataset 4 of 9. ## Merging dataset 5 of 9. ## Merging dataset 6 of 9. ## Merging dataset 7 of 9. ## Merging dataset 8 of 9. ## Merging dataset 9 of 9. ## Merging ASCt1 took 3 seconds or 0.06 minutes. ## Merging took 3 seconds or 0.06 minutes.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Andrés Christiansen. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Christiansen (2024). ILSAmerge: Merge Download International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA) Data. R package version 1.0.1, https://dopatendo.github.io/ILSAmerge/, https://github.com/dopatendo/ILSAmerge.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ILSAmerge: Merge and Download International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA) Data},   author = {Andrés Christiansen},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.0.1, https://dopatendo.github.io/ILSAmerge/},   url = {https://github.com/dopatendo/ILSAmerge}, }

what: Merge and Download International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA) Data
title: Merge and Download International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA) Data
text: common data International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA), like TIMSS, TIMSS Advanced, PIRLS, ICCS, ICILS, CIVED, REDS, RLII, SITES, come unaggregated format. means data published hundreds files, one represents combination countries participants (students, teachers, principals, etc.) also common researches need merge data include countries single file. goal ILSAmerge make process simple straightforward possible.

title: Merge and Download International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA) Data
text: can install stable version ILSAmerge directly CRAN: , wish install development version ILSAmerge:
code: install.packages("ILSAmerge") remotes::install_github("dopatendo/ILSAmerge")

title: Merge and Download International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA) Data
text: merging ILSA data, can use ILSAmerge(). example see vignette("Merge").

title: Merge and Download International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA) Data
text: downloading ILSA data, can use ILSAdownload(). example see “Download ILSA files

title: Merge and Download International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA) Data
text: identifying populations within study, can use ILSAfiles.info(). example see “Identify ILSA files

title: Merge and Download International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA) Data
text: need load ILSA data save , can use justload(). example see “Load ILSA files

title: Download ILSA data — ILSAdownload
text: Downloads 'SPSS' data different International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA). functions supports following ILSA: 'PISA', 'TIMSS', 'TIMSS Advanced', 'PIRLS', 'ICCS', 'ICILS', 'CIVED', 'REDS', 'RLII', 'SITES.' Depending study, need decide data download, read accept terms conditions proceed download.

title: Download ILSA data — ILSAdownload
code: ILSAdownload(   study,   year,   outputdir,   unzip = FALSE,   maxtime = 999,   quiet = FALSE,   agreeLicense = FALSE )

title: Download ILSA data — ILSAdownload
text: study string indicating name study. available studies check description function. year numeric value indicating year study. outputdir directory merged data saved. unzip logical value indicating files unzipped. Default FALSE. maxtime numeric value indicating maximum time allowed downloading file. Default 999. quiet logical value indicating status progress shown. study sub-studies, e.g. 'PISA' 2009 TRUE, main study downloaded. Default FALSE. agreeLicense logical value indicating agree Disclaimer License Agreement file www.iea.nl. FALSE, prompted agree else data downloaded. Default FALSE.

title: Download ILSA data — ILSAdownload
text: Saves 'SPSS' ILSA data locally.

title: Download ILSA data — ILSAdownload
code: # For example, to download 'RLII' 1991 data:  # Path were files will be saved output <- tempdir()   # Downloading 'RLII' 1991 and unzipping files ILSAdownload(study = "RLII", year = 1991, outputdir = output, unzip = TRUE, agreeLicense = TRUE) #> By accessing the Data Repository, IDB Analyzer and Data visualizer, you indicate that you agree to the terms and conditions associated with their use. Please read the Disclaimer and License Agreement for full details. #> 1 files found for RLII 1991. #> Visit https://www.iea.nl/data-tools/repository/readingliteracy to know how to use and cite these datasets.

title: ILSA data files information — ILSAfile.info
text: Aggregates International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA) data files information population.

title: ILSA data files information — ILSAfile.info
code: ILSAfile.info(inputdir)

title: ILSA data files information — ILSAfile.info
text: inputdir string indicating path ILSA 'SPSS' files stored.

title: ILSA data files information — ILSAfile.info
text: data frame number files MBs per population.

title: ILSA data files information — ILSAfile.info
code: # For example, after downloading 'RLII' 1991 G4 data:  # Downloading 'RLII' 1991 and unzipping files ILSAdownload(study = "RLII", year = 1991, outputdir = tempdir(), unzip = TRUE, agreeLicense = TRUE) #> By accessing the Data Repository, IDB Analyzer and Data visualizer, you indicate that you agree to the terms and conditions associated with their use. Please read the Disclaimer and License Agreement for full details. #> 1 files found for RLII 1991. #> Visit https://www.iea.nl/data-tools/repository/readingliteracy to know how to use and cite these datasets.  # Path were raw 'SPSS' files are input <- file.path(tempdir(),"RLII1991_IDB_SPSS/Data")  # Get file information ILSAfile.info(inputdir = input) #>   Population Files   MB #> 1      ASCt1     9 19.9

title: Merge ILSA data — ILSAmerge
text: Merges 'SPSS' data different International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA). function tested behave correctly : 'TIMSS', 'TIMSS Advanced', 'PIRLS', 'ICCS', 'ICILS', 'CIVED', 'REDS', 'RLII', 'SITES' (2006).

title: Merge ILSA data — ILSAmerge
code: ILSAmerge(   inputdir,   outputdir,   population = NULL,   filetype = c("rds", "zsav", "sav"),   MBlimit = NULL,   MBlistlimit = 200,   SPSSlimit = 50,   quiet = FALSE )

title: Merge ILSA data — ILSAmerge
text: inputdir string indicating path ILSA 'SPSS' files stored. outputdir directory merged data saved. population character vector indicating files merged. NULL (default), files merged. information available populations, run ILSAfile.info() first. filetype string indicating type file saved, can "rds", "zsav", "sav". MBlimit numerical value indicating allowed limit combined storage files one type (see ILSAfile.info()). type files go limit, files merged R, 'SPSS' syntax produced via spss.syntax(). set NULL, limit used files merged within R. speed problem, recommend number 200 merge rest 'SPSS'. MBlistlimit numerical value indicating allowed limit combined storage files one type merging list. Values limit merged matrix, slower uses less memory. Default 200. SPSSlimit numerical value indicating limit files per command 'SPSS', typically 50. quiet logical value indicating status progress shown. Default FALSE.

title: Merge ILSA data — ILSAmerge
text: Saves merged ILSA data .sps syntax merging ILSA data.

title: Merge ILSA data — ILSAmerge
code: # For example, after downloading 'RLII' 1991 G4 data:  # Downloading 'RLII' 1991 and unzipping files ILSAdownload(study = "RLII", year = 1991, outputdir = tempdir(), unzip = TRUE, agreeLicense = TRUE) #> By accessing the Data Repository, IDB Analyzer and Data visualizer, you indicate that you agree to the terms and conditions associated with their use. Please read the Disclaimer and License Agreement for full details. #> 1 files found for RLII 1991. #> Visit https://www.iea.nl/data-tools/repository/readingliteracy to know how to use and cite these datasets.  # Path were raw 'SPSS' files are input <- file.path(tempdir(),"RLII1991_IDB_SPSS/Data")  # Path were merged files will be saved output <- file.path(tempdir(),"RLII1991_IDB_SPSS")  # Merging 'RLII' 1991, as .rds file ILSAmerge(inputdir = input, outputdir = output, filetype = "rds", quiet = FALSE) #> 9 files detected. Merging into 1 files. #> Merging ASCt1. Type 1 of 1. #> Merging dataset 1 of 9. #> Merging dataset 2 of 9. #> Merging dataset 3 of 9. #> Merging dataset 4 of 9. #> Merging dataset 5 of 9. #> Merging dataset 6 of 9. #> Merging dataset 7 of 9. #> Merging dataset 8 of 9. #> Merging dataset 9 of 9. #> Merging ASCt1 took 3 seconds or 0.05 minutes. #> Merging took 3 seconds or 0.05 minutes.

what: Loading ILSA data into a list — justload
title: Loading ILSA data into a list — justload
text: Load 'SPSS' data different International Large-Scale Assessments (ILSA), including: 'TIMSS', 'TIMSS Advanced', 'PIRLS', 'ICCS', 'ICILS', 'CIVED', 'REDS', 'RLII', 'SITES' list.

title: Loading ILSA data into a list — justload
code: justload(inputdir, population, justattributes = FALSE)

title: Loading ILSA data into a list — justload
text: inputdir string indicating path ILSA 'SPSS' files stored. population character value indicating files merged. information available populations, run ILSAfile.info() first. justattributes logical value indicating 0 rows loaded. can used just need check column attributes. Default FALSE.

title: Loading ILSA data into a list — justload
text: list tibbles.

title: Loading ILSA data into a list — justload
code: # For example, after downloading 'RLII' 1991 G4 data:  # Downloading 'RLII' 1991 and unzipping files ILSAdownload(study = "RLII", year = 1991, outputdir = tempdir(), unzip = TRUE, agreeLicense = TRUE) #> By accessing the Data Repository, IDB Analyzer and Data visualizer, you indicate that you agree to the terms and conditions associated with their use. Please read the Disclaimer and License Agreement for full details. #> 1 files found for RLII 1991. #> Visit https://www.iea.nl/data-tools/repository/readingliteracy to know how to use and cite these datasets.  # Path were raw 'SPSS' files are input <- file.path(tempdir(),"RLII1991_IDB_SPSS/Data")  # Load only attributes emptylist <- justload(inputdir = input, population = "ASCt1", justattributes = TRUE)  # Load complete data fullist <- justload(inputdir = input, population = "ASCt1", justattributes = FALSE)

title: 'SPSS' merge syntax — spss.syntax
text: Produces saves 'SPSS' merge syntax given list files.

title: 'SPSS' merge syntax — spss.syntax
code: spss.syntax(filelist, name, outputdir, zsav = TRUE, SPSSlimit = 50)

title: 'SPSS' merge syntax — spss.syntax
text: filelist character vector list files merged. name string name merged file (without extension). outputdir directory .sps file merged file saved. zsav logical value indicating merged file compressed zsav. Default TRUE. SPSSlimit numerical value indicating limit files per command 'SPSS', typically 50.

title: 'SPSS' merge syntax — spss.syntax
text: Saves .sps file 'SPSS' syntax merging desired files.

title: 'SPSS' merge syntax — spss.syntax
code: # For example, after downloading 'RLII' 1991 G4 data:  # Downloading 'RLII' 1991 and unzipping files ILSAdownload(study = "RLII", year = 1991, outputdir = tempdir(), unzip = TRUE, agreeLicense = TRUE) #> By accessing the Data Repository, IDB Analyzer and Data visualizer, you indicate that you agree to the terms and conditions associated with their use. Please read the Disclaimer and License Agreement for full details. #> 1 files found for RLII 1991. #> Visit https://www.iea.nl/data-tools/repository/readingliteracy to know how to use and cite these datasets.  # Path were raw 'SPSS' files are input <- file.path(tempdir(),"RLII1991_IDB_SPSS/Data")  # Path were merged files will be saved output <- tempdir()  # List of ASCt1 files to be merged files <- list.files(path = input, pattern = "ASC.+t1")  # Create 'SPSS' syntax spss.syntax(filelist = files, name = "ASCt1", outputdir = output, zsav = TRUE)

title: ILSAmerge 1.0.1
text: Added extensive new documentation.

title: ILSAmerge 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2024-11-08 CRAN submission. Added PISA TALIS ILSAdownload(). ILSAdownload() connects GitHub check recent links.

title: ILSAmerge 0.8.4
text: Fixed internal argument checks. Added ILSAdownload() downloading ILSA SPSS datasets.

title: ILSAmerge 0.8.1
text: Added justload() load files list merge save .

title: ILSAmerge 0.8.0
text: Initial version
